Ph.D. or masters degree in computer science or NLP related field.

Ability to communicate/collaborate with other researchers/engineers including our team members in China (ability to speak Chinese is NOT required).

Ability to implement experiments using scripting languages (Python, Perl, bash) and tools written in C/C++.

Experience working with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, Pytorch, Torch, Mxnet, CNTK, etc.) and related tools in each special field.

Publication record in top NLP conferences (ACL, NAACL, EMNLP, NIPS, SIGIR, WWW etc) is a plus.

Publication record in top conferences (ICML, ICLR, NIPS, KDD, IJCAI, AAAI etc ) is a plus.

About JD.com and Silicon Valley Labs

JD.com is China's largest online retailer and the biggest overall retailer, as well as the country's biggest Internet company by revenue. In 2017, JD.com reported a net revenue that reached 362.3 billion CNY (US$55.689 billion), an increase of 40.3 percent year-over-year. Google, Walmart, Tencent, Intel, and Farfetch are our strategic partners.

JD.com sets the standard for online shopping through its commitment to quality, authenticity, and its vast product offering covering everything from fresh food and apparel to electronics and cosmetics. Its unrivaled nationwide fulfillment network provides standard same-day and next-day delivery, covering a population of more than 1 billion with a level of service and speed that is unmatched globally.

As a technology-driven company, JD.com is the world's leading company in high tech and AI delivery through drones, autonomous technology, and robots, and possesses the largest drone delivery system, infrastructure, and capability in the world. Our global R&D efforts are headquartered at Silicon Valley Labs in Mountain View, CA. The Silicon Valley Labs focus on building technology and services that will improve user experience and empower our business partners. Areas of research and development include: artificial intelligence, autonomous driving, robotics, computer vision, natural language processing, machine and deep learning, big data, and AR/VR.

Visit https://corporate.jd.com/ for more information.

About J D AI Research (JDAIR)

JD AI Research (JDAIR) focuses on the continuous innovation and optimization of algorithms to meet our developing business needs. Significant areas of research include natural language processing, spoken dialog systems, computer vision, and machine learning (including deep learning and reinforcement learning). JDAIR has established research centers in Beijing and Silicon Valley, and we are in the process of opening an additional research center in Europe.

position: MLT/MLS Lab Tech Intern - Core Lab- The Jewish Hospital Mercy Health
description:
Thank you for considering a career at Mercy Health


The Lab Intern assist physicians and other specialists by performing all aspects of testing on blood, tissue, and other bodily fluids, the results of which can then be used to diagnose and treat patients.

Essential Job Functions

  • Performs waived and moderate complexity laboratory diagnostic tests.
  • Confirms test results and provides the physician with data necessary to determine the presence, extent, cause, and treatment of disease.
  • Follows quality control programs, assuring the accuracy and reliability of test results.
  • Monitors, maintains, and troubleshoots laboratory instruments and equipment.
  • Performs computer function on both Lab Information Systems (LIS) and Hospital Information Systems (HIS).
  • Participates in continuing education in respective areas of expertise.
  • Performs, records, and evaluates Quality Control.
  • Assists with inventory control.
  • May perform additional assignments not directly related to the job description. "

Education Requirements:

Currently enrolled in an accredited Health Science program (Medical Laboratory Science or Medical Lab Technology) leading to an Associate's or Bachelor's degree (required)

Mercy Health is an equal opportunity employer.

We’ll also reward your hard work with:

  • Comprehensive, affordable medical, dental and vision plans
  • Prescription drug coverage
  • Flexible spending accounts
  • Life insurance w/AD&D
  • An employer-matched 403(b) for those who qualify.
  • Paid time off
  • Educational Assistance
  • And much more

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

16

Work Shift:

Days/Evenings

Department:

Core Laboratory - Jewish

Looking to work in an environment that has been certified as a 2021 Best Places to Work? If so, Tri Pointe Homes is the company for you.


We are proud to offer an internship opportunity as a Developer within our IT department to future leaders looking to pursue a career in Homebuilding. Our internship program provides both real-world work experience as well as opportunities to understand what we do and how we do it.

At Tri Pointe Homes, we are intentional about fostering an environment where you, and all individuals, are encouraged to be their authentic selves. At Centerstone, our mission is delivering care that changes people’s lives. For over 60 years, Centerstone has been providing community-based behavioral health care, substance-abuse treatment and therapeutic foster care services across the U.S. We’re committed to bringing passionate and customer experience-focused individuals to help us continue to provide the best care to our communities. If you think you’re a good match to join our organization, please review the career opportunity below and submit your application. We look forward to hearing from you!


Job Description:

It is the desire of Centerstone to offer an educational opportunity to a Master's or Bachelor's level intern, while still providing the highest quality of consumer care. This internship opportunity is in Carbondale, IL area and is within our Outpatient program.

Students pursing Master's or Bachelor's degree in Behavioral Science, Counseling, Psychology, Social Work, or related fields are encouraged to apply.

Internships are unpaid positions. Additional questions may be directed to cristina.waddell@centerstone.org .

Part time

TourMega (http://tourmega.com) is an exciting new travel startup that’s looking to disrupt the tours and activities space. We are using AI to assist the users easily plan then enjoy their trip with only a few clicks. We are also collecting data from various travel sites from all over the world to build a platform that generate trip itineraries that include point of interests & attractions, tours and activities, as well as restaurants for our users based on their travel interests and behaviors.
We have the largest tours, activities, points of interest inventory in the world of over 300,000 tours, 200,000 points of interests and landmarks in a 190 countries and 5000 cities. In addition, we are also building and a chatbot to assist our users with any travel questions on-the-go.

We’re looking for a computer science graduate intern who wants to help us with the following things:

  • Web scraping – How to collect data from different websites, process them, and turn them into your data
  • Collecting data via API
  • Integrate search data into your search servers like elasticsearch
  • Build a recommendation system using machine learning algorithms like NLP, data entity extra extractions, etc
  • Build and add many features to our web app that runs on Ruby on Rails.

Qualifications:

  • You’re pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related fields
  • You have some basic programming background and experience
  • Knowledge of Web scraping - Ruby / Python
  • Knowledge Regular expression, javascript skills is a plus
  • Knowledge or experience with Ruby on Rails is a plus

Bonus:

  • You love to travel
  • Willing to learn new skills, tech stacks
  • Strong communication skills, adaptable and work under pressure

Interested candidates please send your resume to jobs @ tourmega.com with a link to your portfolio or github profile. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Looking for Summer 2021 deep learning developer intern!

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to work with our experienced software engineers to build and enhance MATLAB deep learning features. This position requires someone who has an eye for detail and is passionate about improving the integration between MATLAB and other deep learning libraries such as TensorFlow and Pytorch.

As an intern, you will receive a combination of practical experience and training in a work environment that fosters and rewards cooperation, teamwork, learning, and fun.

This internship will prepare you for a career at MathWorks starting in our Engineering Development Group (EDG).


After training on MathWorks development processes and tools, you will work with the statistics and machine learning team on:

  • Testing importing and exporting of deep learning models
  • Helping to explore, design, develop and maintain connections with open-source deep learning frameworks
  • Implementing custom versions of network layers
  • Writing deep learning examples using the co-execution approach or model-exchange approach

  • Pursuing an MS or PhD in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with a strong academic record
  • Experience implementing deep learning or machine learning features
  • Experience using deep learning libraries such as TensorFlow or Pytorch
  • Experience in programming and object-oriented design
  • Strong communication skills
  • 3 months full-time commitment

  • Candidates must be pursuing a master's level or a PhD level degree in a technical discipline.
  • Experience with MATLAB
  • Experience with C++
  • Experience with Deep Learning

position: Solutions Engineer Intern - San Mateo, CA
description:
About Verkada
At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we’re transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades—and we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.

Verkada is seeking Solutions Engineer Interns, based in San Mateo, CA, to own and enhance the customer experience, from the proof-of-concept to the final decision. This individual will provide technical support to the sales team, become a trusted advisor to customers, assist the sales team in designing security systems and quotes, and create solutions for unique customer challenges. You will join a team of highly motivated people delivering impactful results for the company. We are looking primarily for people who can match our fast pace and learn quickly, but prior experience with video security systems, IoT devices and access control systems is certainly helpful.

Responsibilities:

    • Work alongside Solutions Engineers to design and deliver technical solutions for our customers and key stakeholders
    • Collaborate with Engineering and Product teams to test new products and identify bugs
    • Communicate complex technical matters both verbally and written
    • Influence product direction with your unique understanding of customer needs
    • Prepare required project documentation (floorplans, scope of work, assumptions, etc.)
    • Research and document hybrid cloud security trends in the industry which includes IoT, networking, and cybersecurity

Qualifications:

    • Third or Fourth year college student working towards a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a related discipline: Networking, Telecommunications, Systems Administration, Information technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Cybersecurity
    • Strong background in IT fundamentals: Experience with TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and routing/switching devices; No experience with products related to physical security or cloud-based video necessary: we can teach you
    • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in order to clearly and efficiently articulate technical matters with customers and partners
    • Excellent time management, follow-through, and attention to detail
    • Experience working with APIs, Python, and other coding languages is a plus
    • Experience working with Linux operating systems preferred
    • Genuine excitement for software and hardware products and can speak comfortably about how they work
    • Entrepreneurial and positive attitude with a strong desire to learn
    • Industry certifications are a plus: AWS, CCNA, MCSE, CEH, Security+, A+, Network+
    • Must be authorized to work in the U.S (Position does not provide sponsorship)
About our team
Behind the scenes, we’re a team of computer scientists, hardware engineers and experienced founders who saw a chance to make a real impact. We’re united by the challenge of building beautiful products, designed for real people—and by our commitment to using technology responsibly. We believe keeping data private and secure is core to our safety as individuals, businesses and communities and we put great care into building systems that embody our values as people. Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

Job ID: 2560
Location:Auburn Hills, US

Vitesco Technologies is a leading international developer and manufacturer of state-of-the-art powertrain technologies for sustainable mobility. With smart system solutions and components for electric, hybrid and internal combustion drivetrains, Vitesco Technologies makes mobility clean, efficient and affordable.


Job description:
Seeking a Software Engineering Intern for our Auburn Hills South, MI location. The internship provides the candidate with a valuable opportunity to work with a skilled team in a variety of engineering and production roles. The Software Engineering team at Continental is world wide and provides you an opportunity to work with colleagues in other countries. You will work closely with your manager and be paired with an experienced mentor on your team. You'll learn about Real time automotive embedded System applications by working on real customer projects, features and updates. You will be part of designing solutions, developing and testing Software and working with state of the art test equipment. The best part offered in this position is to learn the real world challenges and gain experience in solving them. We are flexible with work schedule.


Job Requirements :
Required Qualifications:
  • Must be enrolled in a US accredited degree program pursuing degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Embedded System Engineering, or Automotive Software Engineering
  • Must maintain a minimum GPA of a 2.8
  • Must be minimum Sophomore standing
  • Must be available to intern longer than summer only
  • Must be available to work minimum 2 school semesters
  • Interest in the Tech industry
  • Knowledge of algorithms, C programming
  • Sound knowledge of the Microsoft office tools
  • Able to systematically solve problems and perform root cause analysis with limited supervision
  • Able to recommend innovative ideas to achieve results in efficient ways
  • Perform testing and troubleshooting in a variety of engineering tasks
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of the Micro¬controller architecture
  • Understands the Software Development V cycles
  • Gather, record and maintain engineering specific information
  • Knowledge of C/assembly programming for microcontroller
  • Knowledge of testing embedded software

Working Time: [[mfield3]]


Your Contact Partner: Daniel Cable

Continental offers equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to unlawful consideration to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. In addition, as a federal contractor, Continental complies with government regulations, including affirmative action responsibilities, where they apply. If you need assistance in the application process, please reply to Careers@conti-na.com or contact US Recruiting at 248.209.7425. This telephone line and email address are reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requesting accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Please do not call about the status of your job application, if you do not require accessibility assistance or an accommodation. Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or non-disability related technical issues, will not receive a call back.

Vitesco Technologies is a leading international developer and manufacturer of state-of-the-art powertrain technologies for sustainable mobility. With smart system solutions and components for electric, hybrid and internal combustion vehicles, Vitesco Technologies makes mobility clean, efficient and affordable. The product range includes electric drives, electronic control units, sensors and actuators, and exhaust-gas aftertreatment solutions. In 2020, Vitesco Technologies recorded sales of around 8 billion Euros and employs almost 40,000 people at around 50 locations worldwide. Vitesco Technologies is headquartered in Regensburg, Germany.



Nearest Major Market: Detroit

Intern Job Description:

Øptimus Analytics, a data science and software company, is seeking a data science intern in their Washington D.C. area office or remotely for the summer term. Interns with the Data Science & Predictive Analytics team will participate in all aspects of work at Øptimus. In an environment where a “long-term” project lasts one or two weeks, no two days are the same. You won't be getting coffee. You'll sit in on meetings and work on multiple projects: writing call scripts that are used in hundreds of thousands of calls, streamlining our current workflow, and creating statistical models to meet the needs of our clients, just to name a few. You'll be doing the work that a full-time employee does. We'll match what you're good at with what you enjoy and what we need.

Our internships are mostly geared towards those still in school, whether undergraduate or graduate students as well as recent graduates. This job posting is for the summer 2021 period, with flexible starting dates between May and June full time preferred but part-time considered. We don't guarantee full-time employment after an internship, but we're a growing firm and are always looking for bright, hard-working talent. If you're looking for a full-time job, this is a good first step and puts you ahead of the competition!

Qualifications:

  • Must be able to learn quickly and juggle multiple projects with moving deadlines.
  • Must have strong analytical skills.
  • Must have at least one course in quantitative research such as statistics or applied research.
  • Must have courses or experience in machine learning, data mining, regression, generalized linear models, experimental design, and/or GIS
  • Must have killer Excel skills and be incredibly competent in Word, PowerPoint
  • Must have experience in R or Python - both are a plus!
  • Experience with computer programming is a plus.
  • Experience with statistical modeling is a plus.


Compensation:

Internships with Øptimus are paid commensurate with professional and academic experience on a 1099 basis.

Company:

Øptimus Analytics is a family of statisticians, graphic designers, data scientists, programmers, social media marketing analysts, and recovering politicos. Since its founding in 2013, Øptimus has been at the forefront of developing innovative data and analytics software platforms. Øptimus has designed and delivered data-driven strategies for leading political campaigns, Fortune 500 companies, and non-profits around the globe.

We handle a wide variety of projects and use many different technologies and programs to meet our clients' needs, so our culture here is one of constant learning and curiosity, while doing things the right way. We boast office space in a beautiful building on the Old Town Alexandria waterfront near the yellow and blue Metro lines, no cubicles, a nacho cheese machine, and free staff lunch on Wednesdays. If you work remotely with Øptimus, you will be provided with a company issued laptop and the same training, tools and support offered to our in-office staff. If you live by the "work hard, play hard" philosophy, then you'll be a great fit with the Øptimus team.

Intern Job Description:

Øptimus Analytics, a data science and software company, is seeking a data science intern in their Washington D.C. area office or remotely for the summer term. Interns with the Data Science & Predictive Analytics team will participate in all aspects of work at Øptimus. In an environment where a “long-term” project lasts one or two weeks, no two days are the same. You won't be getting coffee. You'll sit in on meetings and work on multiple projects: writing call scripts that are used in hundreds of thousands of calls, streamlining our current workflow, and creating statistical models to meet the needs of our clients, just to name a few. You'll be doing the work that a full-time employee does. We'll match what you're good at with what you enjoy and what we need.

Our internships are mostly geared towards those still in school, whether undergraduate or graduate students as well as recent graduates. This job posting is for the summer 2021 period, with flexible starting dates between May and June full time preferred but part-time considered. We don't guarantee full-time employment after an internship, but we're a growing firm and are always looking for bright, hard-working talent. If you're looking for a full-time job, this is a good first step and puts you ahead of the competition!

Qualifications:

  • Must be able to learn quickly and juggle multiple projects with moving deadlines.
  • Must have strong analytical skills.
  • Must have at least one course in quantitative research such as statistics or applied research.
  • Must have courses or experience in machine learning, data mining, regression, generalized linear models, experimental design, and/or GIS
  • Must have killer Excel skills and be incredibly competent in Word, PowerPoint
  • Must have experience in R or Python - both are a plus!
  • Experience with computer programming is a plus.
  • Experience with statistical modeling is a plus.


Compensation:

Internships with Øptimus are paid commensurate with professional and academic experience on a 1099 basis.

Company:

Øptimus Analytics is a family of statisticians, graphic designers, data scientists, programmers, social media marketing analysts, and recovering politicos. Since its founding in 2013, Øptimus has been at the forefront of developing innovative data and analytics software platforms. Øptimus has designed and delivered data-driven strategies for leading political campaigns, Fortune 500 companies, and non-profits around the globe.

We handle a wide variety of projects and use many different technologies and programs to meet our clients' needs, so our culture here is one of constant learning and curiosity, while doing things the right way. We boast office space in a beautiful building on the Old Town Alexandria waterfront near the yellow and blue Metro lines, no cubicles, a nacho cheese machine, and free staff lunch on Wednesdays. If you work remotely with Øptimus, you will be provided with a company issued laptop and the same training, tools and support offered to our in-office staff. If you live by the "work hard, play hard" philosophy, then you'll be a great fit with the Øptimus team.

Company Description


The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.


Job Description


Bosch Research is looking for an intern in atomistic computational materials science to join the materials design team. Our goal is to enable improved Bosch products through deep understanding of thermodynamic, kinetic, and transport phenomena on an atomic level using both quantum and classical simulations. Strong focus is placed on development and application of computational and machine-learning methods for understanding and automated discovery of next-generation materials, primarily for electrochemistry and energy conversion.

In this particular position, the intern will focus on studying the kinetics of water diffusion and water uptake in polymeric systems. Advanced atomistic methods will be employed to investigate degradation mechanisms and their impact on the polymeric system's static/dynamic mechanical properties. This work is relevant for the development of the diverse polymer materials portfolio of Bosch.

As part of Bosch Corporate Research, we are dedicated to long-term fundamental investigations of transformative energy technologies. Located in Cambridge, close to MIT and Harvard, our materials computation team supports global experimental efforts with fundamental understanding, emphasizing innovation and high technological impact. Using both internal funding and government grants, we collaborate closely with a network of leading computational and experimental teams which includes top universities, national labs and industrial partners. We strongly encourage high-impact publications and patent applications.


Qualifications


Required Qualification:

  • Ph.D. candidate at a top university in chemical engineering, physics, chemistry, materials science, or a related field.
  • Solid foundations in materials science, solid-state physics, and/or chemistry
  • Attention to detail, flexibility, creativity, and excellent communication and teamwork skills

Desired Qualification:

  • Experience in atomistic simulations, preferably density-functional theory, molecular dynamics, and/or quantum chemistry
  • Significant research and/or coding experience, preferably with fluency in Python and FORTRAN/C++
  • Strong background in physics and coding, and passion on working and understanding physics-based devices

Additional Information


Duration: 14 weeks (est.)

Stansberry Research is looking for an Engineering Intern to complement a team of technical professionals within Engineering. This is an exciting role that will have a direct impact in building a world class technology ecosystem sitting alongside a world class Marketing Business.

The Engineering Intern will be responsible for working within the engineering team on projects to further grow various aspects of the business. This role will assist and learn from full stack developers, business intelligence analysts, data engineers, data scientists and QA engineers. You will have an opportunity to use the latest cloud technology platforms in Data Warehouses, BI Tools, ETL Tools, along with the some of the most relevant SaaS based software in the industry. In addition to using the latest technology, you will learn marketing from a world class marketing organization.

About Stansberry Research:

At Stansberry Research, we thrive on new ideas and the entrepreneurial spirit. Naturally, we always look for new people, explorers, and innovators. If you are interested in a career where your ideas won't only be heard but rather celebrated, we'd like to hear from you.

Founded in 1999 and based in Baltimore, Maryland, Stansberry Research is the largest independent source of financial insight in the world. It delivers unbiased investment advice to self-directed investors seeking an edge in a wide variety of sectors and market conditions.

Stansberry Research has nearly two dozen analysts and researchers – including former hedge-fund managers and buy-side financial experts. They produce a steady stream of timely research on value investing, income generation, natural resources, biotech, financials, short-selling, macroeconomic analysis, options trading and more.

The company's uncompromised insight has made it one of the most respected and sought-after research organizations in the financial sector. Stansberry Research has nearly 1 million readers and more than 250,000 paid subscribers in well over 100 countries.

Position Summary

Samsung is a world leader in Memory, LCD and System LSI technologies. We are currently looking for exceptional software and hardware talent to join our Samsung Austin R & D Center (SARC) in Austin, TX and our Advanced Computing Lab (ACL) in San Jose, CA. SARC was established in Austin, TX in 2010 to be one of Samsung’s strategic investments in high performance low power ARM based device technology. Presently our GPU design teams, located in Austin (SARC) and San Jose (ACL), are developing a GPU that will be deployed in Samsung mobile products. Our System IP team located in Austin (SARC) is working on Coherent Interconnect and memory controller architectures.

Managing a large, complex IT Infrastructure is no small task. Samsung SARC/ACL IT service operations works across many technologies and operates the current and next wave of infrastructure, application, platform and virtual technologies. As an IT Intern, you will support a variety of project based assignments working closely with our IT organization and team members across SARC/ACL.

Role and Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include:

  • Document Run Book and/or User portal for common issues
  • Adhere to all Samsung security protocols
  • Provide friendly customer support
  • Providing level 1 Linux system administration support to Engineering users
  • Hands-on server/hardware debugging and problem remediation
  • Monitor and maintain compute grid server availability and stability regularly
  • Interact and communicate with other IT teams for projects and ticket resolution
  • Service day to day internal team and end user work request tickets in timely manner
  • Automating routine IT manual tasks using bash scripting or Python scripting
  • Documenting day to day tasks, Runbooks, How-Tos, FAQs for end users and IT admins and follow run books
  • Reviewing, improving, and generating documentation for multiple areas within Engineering IT
  • Document Best Known Methods of resolution for streamlined support
  • Deploying Linux compute servers, Virtual machines or Containers based on Runbooks and user ticket requirements
  • Intern project work with significant automation tasks

Skills and Qualifications

Minimum requirements:

  • Pursuing a degree in Information Systems Management, Information Technology, Computer Science or related fields
  • Basic knowledge and familiarity with Linux, TCP/IP networking, or Windows.
  • Basic knowledge of scripting or programming. Python preferred
  • Basic Knowledge and familiarity with Linux command-line.
  • Basic understanding of networks
  • Basic understanding of computer and computer components
  • Desire to learn and to work with others
  • Customer service experience.

Job Description


In this internship role, you will conduct design and development to build and optimize deep learning framework software. As cybercriminals become more sophisticated, we need to provide simple, yet powerful solutions to help our customers defend their digital environments. Are you up for the challenge?

The Vulnerability Risk Management Practice team is looking for a spirited UX Design Intern to create thoughtful onboarding experiences that drive customer outcomes and help our users achieve their cybersecurity goals. Our ideal teammate thrives in a fast-paced environment, believes that learning is a critical aspect of the user experience, and is a self-starter.

In this role, you'll partner with your practice counterparts to:

  • Work within a customer-centric, outcomes-focused cybersecurity practice and build deep understanding of the cybersecurity user and their challenges, including threat detection and response, the incident response lifecycle, and risk management.

  • Collaborate across multiple practice and geographically distributed teams to unite UX writers and content designers as a collective, and ensure cohesive content experiences within our platform and brand portfolio.

  • Work with fellow UXers across practices to establish a tight knit culture of growth, learning, and strong UX advocacy.

You'll also work hand-in-hand with:

  • UX Designers to craft content experiences end-to-end that guide our customers to achieve their outcomes.

  • Product Management and Go-To-Customer experts to identify and balance business goals, and end-to-end content experiences that expand product knowledge for our internal and external stakeholders.

  • Research, Support, and Customer Success to understand how our customers actually use and deploy our products in the real world.

  • Visual Design and UX Engineering to work within and contribute to our design system, and ensure necessary content elements and editorial guidelines are available to PM, UX, and engineering partners.

  • Software Engineering with direct partnership and collaboration on technical details to understand what needs to be documented, how, at what granularity, and by which medium.

A Snapshot of the Work You'll Be Doing

  • Help create a strategy for onboarding

  • Find gaps by inventorying and auditing the current onboarding experience.

  • Understand data needs by working with ux-ers, product managers, and engineers.

  • Create a proposal for an onboarding tying to our customer value realization metrics.

  • Craft templates for Pendo guides leveraging the work from other designers.

To thrive in this role, you should have:

  • Experience working on projects (academically or professionally) with multiple stakeholders.

  • Experience with design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Invision, or Adobe creative cloud tools

  • Strong project management skills

  • The ability to be a team player

  • Ability to create detail oriented annotated wireframes, documentation, and mockups.

  • Understand and articulate interaction design principles and processes.

  • Communication skills - ability to present your work effectively

  • Growth-oriented mindset.

And finally, it'd also be extra nice if you have the following experience:

  • A new graduate with a BA/BS degree in Psychology, Human Factors, Communications, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

  • Experience with using Pendo

  • Experience working in a security company and/or complex work domain is a plus

What you will need

A UX portfolio (or artifact examples) that demonstrates your work. We want to see case studies that demonstrate your impact on the projects you have worked on. Please make sure to include a link in your resume.

AMD Research seeks a Computer Science or Engineering graduate student to work on high-performance computer software and hardware. You will be responsible for developing innovations that feed into scaled-out systems incorporating a variety of current and emerging accelerators and tightly coupled CPUs. The work has the potential to directly impact the current production software stack as well as influence the direction of future hardware and software.


AMD Research nurtures and encourages all co-ops to file quality patents and publish at top-tier research venues out of their internship projects. SUMMARY

The Immunization Coalition of Los Angeles County (ICLAC) seeks a detail-oriented, energetic, and responsible Master of Public Health (MPH) Intern to assist in providing staff support for a project intervention based on the Los Angeles County Community Based Adult Services (CBAS) survey. CBAS centers provide rehabilitative health care services to disabled and chronically ill adults, most of whom are over 65 years of age. Under the supervision of the Immunization Coalition Coordinator, the Intern will work directly with pharmacy partners and CBAS centers to coordinate vaccine clinic logistics such as timing, structure, as part of a research and intervention project. The Intern will be available to answer and clarify any questions the administrators or staff may have about the project.

The project end goal is to:

  • Increase access to influenza and pneumococcal vaccinations for CBAS center staff and participants.
  • Increase knowledge about influenza transmission factors, safety and efficacy of influenza and pneumococcal vaccinations, and the urgent importance of ensuring influenza vaccination for high risk participants, especially in the setting of COVID-19.
  • Increase positive perceptions of annual influenza immunizations for staff and participants.

This is a part time, non-benefitted position (28 hours per week). The pay rate is $15.00 per hour.

Employment is provided by Heluna Health.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • For background information, conduct a literature review on vaccine clinic and education interventions with high risk adult populations.
  • Conduct Outreach to CBAS centers by telephone and/or in person to determine the center’s flu vaccine clinic and staff education needs, timing, and structure of the proposed intervention/clinic.
  • Assist with scheduling vaccination clinic logistics with pharmacy partners.
  • Administer Knowledge, Attitudes, Behavior (KAB) pre-post survey by telephone/or fax among all CBAS center staff and participants who attend the educational webinar.
  • May identify and compile educational resources on adult immunizations, e.g., the recommended schedule, influenza, and pneumoccoal immunizations in multiple languages or as needed for the educational intervention.
  • Prepare power point slides to convey CBAS project information to partners, stakeholders, and clinic staff/participants as needed.
  • Take notes and memos during research team meetings (i.e. type documents, drafts, and reports; sort and manage files).
  • Assist with education and coalition webinars as needed including technology management, preparing Power Point slides, as well as managing Question and Answer sessions during webinars.
  • Verify completion and accuracy of surveys, and other relevant tracking forms as necessary.
  • Assist with data entry as needed for data analysis purposes.
  • Provide weekly updates to research team.
  • Other duties as may be assigned.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education/Experience

Must be currently enrolled as an MPH student or graduate of an accredited School of Public Health university/college. All Epidemiology and Community Health Science MPH candidates strongly desired and encouraged to apply.

Certificates/Licenses/Clearances

  • A valid California driver’s license, proof of vehicle insurance, and reliable transportation OR the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions
  • Successful clearance of the Live Scan process through Los Angeles County
  • Medical clearance required

Other Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-directed and able to work without supervision
  • Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Stand Frequently

Walk Frequently

Handling / Fingering Frequently

Reach Outward Occasionally

Reach Above Shoulder Occasionally

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Most job assignments/duties will be completed remotely using the employee’s own computer, telephone, and/or email/fax. May require periodic travel between CBAS center sites in Los Angeles County. Therefore, medical clearance will be required and an N95 mask and face shield distributed. Due to COVID-19, project assignments and activities will be completed remotely at the employee’s place of residence. Must have wireless internet service and/or capability. You may need to report to a physical office location in Koreatown (located in Los Angeles CA) to use fax machines, copiers, computers and other essential office equipment.

Heluna Health is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that encourages minorities, women, veterans, and disabled to apply.

MCAD or ECAD experience.

Motivation to learn new skills.

BS in Computer Science, Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent.

New graduates accepted with demonstrable relevant professional experience.

Company

Anark is a leading provider of intelligent information management (IIM) software and solutions for technical industry, enabling engineering, procurement, manufacturing, and field service organizations to publish and manage technical content, for access and collaboration workflows across the extended enterprise—yielding faster iterations, reduced material waste, and higher-quality products and services with substantial cost savings.

Anark helps market leaders such as GE, Boeing, Lockheed Martin, Allison Transmission, Johnson & Johnson, Cisco, Ericsson, and TE Connectivity with their Digital Transformation, leveraging smart technical content to streamline procurement, manufacturing, and field service operations.

SUMMARY

The Immunization Coalition of Los Angeles County (ICLAC) seeks a detail-oriented, energetic, and responsible Master of Public Health (MPH) Intern to assist in providing staff support for a project intervention based on the Los Angeles County Community Based Adult Services (CBAS) survey. CBAS centers provide rehabilitative health care services to disabled and chronically ill adults, most of whom are over 65 years of age. Under the supervision of the Immunization Coalition Coordinator, the Intern will work directly with pharmacy partners and CBAS centers to coordinate vaccine clinic logistics such as timing, structure, as part of a research and intervention project. The Intern will be available to answer and clarify any questions the administrators or staff may have about the project.

The project end goal is to:

  • Increase access to influenza and pneumococcal vaccinations for CBAS center staff and participants.
  • Increase knowledge about influenza transmission factors, safety and efficacy of influenza and pneumococcal vaccinations, and the urgent importance of ensuring influenza vaccination for high risk participants, especially in the setting of COVID-19.
  • Increase positive perceptions of annual influenza immunizations for staff and participants.

This is a part time, non-benefitted position (28 hours per week). The pay rate is $15.00 per hour.

Employment is provided by Heluna Health.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • For background information, conduct a literature review on vaccine clinic and education interventions with high risk adult populations.
  • Conduct Outreach to CBAS centers by telephone and/or in person to determine the center’s flu vaccine clinic and staff education needs, timing, and structure of the proposed intervention/clinic.
  • Assist with scheduling vaccination clinic logistics with pharmacy partners.
  • Administer Knowledge, Attitudes, Behavior (KAB) pre-post survey by telephone/or fax among all CBAS center staff and participants who attend the educational webinar.
  • May identify and compile educational resources on adult immunizations, e.g., the recommended schedule, influenza, and pneumoccoal immunizations in multiple languages or as needed for the educational intervention.
  • Prepare power point slides to convey CBAS project information to partners, stakeholders, and clinic staff/participants as needed.
  • Take notes and memos during research team meetings (i.e. type documents, drafts, and reports; sort and manage files).
  • Assist with education and coalition webinars as needed including technology management, preparing Power Point slides, as well as managing Question and Answer sessions during webinars.
  • Verify completion and accuracy of surveys, and other relevant tracking forms as necessary.
  • Assist with data entry as needed for data analysis purposes.
  • Provide weekly updates to research team.
  • Other duties as may be assigned.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education/Experience

Must be currently enrolled as an MPH student or graduate of an accredited School of Public Health university/college. All Epidemiology and Community Health Science MPH candidates strongly desired and encouraged to apply.

Certificates/Licenses/Clearances

  • A valid California driver’s license, proof of vehicle insurance, and reliable transportation OR the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions
  • Successful clearance of the Live Scan process through Los Angeles County
  • Medical clearance required

Other Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-directed and able to work without supervision
  • Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Most job assignments/duties will be completed remotely using the employee’s own computer, telephone, and/or email/fax. May require periodic travel between CBAS center sites in Los Angeles County. Therefore, medical clearance will be required and an N95 mask and face shield distributed. Due to COVID-19, project assignments and activities will be completed remotely at the employee’s place of residence. Must have wireless internet service and/or capability. You may need to report to a physical office location in Koreatown (located in Los Angeles CA) to use fax machines, copiers, computers and other essential office equipment.

Heluna Health is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that encourages minorities, women, veterans, and disabled to apply.

  • Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) using pre-tax dollars for qualified medical expenses

  • If you work in the office, we’re strictly business casual so you can skip the dry cleaner
  • Our corporate office is conveniently located in Walled Lake, MI, easy to access from the entire Metro Detroit area

Oncology Analytics is a leading data analytics and technology-enabled services company dedicated to helping health plans, providers, life sciences and patients with solutions that are purpose-built for oncology. Through an evidence-based, real-world analytics approach to utilization management, Oncology Analytics’ prior authorization platform is used by health plans and their network physicians to support 7 million health plan members in the US and Puerto Rico.

About the Role

The Engineering Intern works in an Agile environment with responsibilities for designing, coding, testing, insuring data integrity, and deploying and debugging software applications and services. This role will be responsible for working with product managers, technical program managers, software developers and quality engineers to help ensure high quality of services.

  • Design, develop, test, debug, deploy software solutions

  • Develop software testing procedures, programming, and documentation
  • Improve operations by conducting systems analysis
  • Provide production support for escalated issues
  • Perform validation and verification testing
  • Document development phases and monitor systems
  • Review and debug code

About You

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar engineering/analytical program.

  • Academic or practical experience with C#, .NET., SQL Server and any JavaScript framework is required.


About the Location


The majority of your team will be located in the Greater Atlanta area; however, we are open to remote work preferably in the Eastern or Central times zone.


Our Culture


Taking ownership of quick action, critically thinking through the needs, and working well with others are key competencies of team member success. Our leadership is dedicated to building a culture based on respect, clinical excellence, innovation – all with a focused mission of putting patients first!


We offer a full benefit package starting on your first day, along with a company bonus and equity so you can experience the value of our growth along with the rest of the team. You will work from (or visit) our very modern and engaging offices, and experience a fun, collaborative environment where social activities and community events matter. We enjoy being together!


The Opportunity


The cost of cancer related medical services and prescription drugs in the United States is expected to reach $246 billion by 2030. Oncology Analytics has enjoyed rapid growth over the past 3 years and seeks smart, collaborative people to join its team. We have just under 200 team members, so we can move swiftly but precisely to the market needs of our customers. Strongly backed financially by leading healthcare equity partners, we remain in an investment mode. This means we are open-minded to how we get the work done – now is the perfect time to talk to us!


Our Current Solutions


Through the use of Oncology Analytics’ utilization management system, OneUM, our customers can use a single e-Prior Authorization portal for all oncology drug request and treatments. Our system improves quality of care, reduces provider abrasion and gives health plans visibility into the total cost of oncology treatment.


Oncology Analytics offers Oncology Insights Pro, an analytic software solution that enables health plans to use data and analytics to improve oncology programs. Using real world data, our engineers normalize data to create analytic dashboards with drill down compatibilities. The data is the paired with expert guidance providing the strategies an insight needed to keep up with the continuing evolving cancer treatment landscape.


Oncology Analytics offers Pharmacy Consulting services to health plans and pharmaceutical companies. New cancer treatments are entering the market at an unrelenting pace. Since 2018, the FDA approved 121 new cancer applications including 49 novel cancer drug entities. Our Board-Certified Oncology Pharmacologists can help health plans update drug policies, offer utilization management and formulary advice, and development training for staff.


Our digital health solution is coming soon. Stay tuned!

Job Description


The developer software engineering team, is seeking motivated intern researchers in the area of parallel computing research applied towards high performance computing on FPGAs. This is a full-time internship position with the Parallel Computing Lab, sponsored by Developer Software Engineering. The Parallel Computing Lab researches new algorithms, architectures, and approaches to address the most challenging compute- and data-intensive applications. We are focused on delivering new Intel software and hardware technologies that will transform the enterprise and technical computing experience. We work in close collaboration with leading academic and industry partners to accomplish our mission.

In this position, you will be responsible for conceiving, researching, and prototyping parallel computing algorithms and frameworks targeting FPGAs, and you will develop relevant software and hardware technologies with the goal of converting these into products and fueling Intel's growth. You will use your strong knowledge of scientific principles to identify and research promising technologies typically 2+ years prior to product development. You will enhance our spatial programming language and compilers, and use them to implement high performance kernels on Intel FPGAs.

This requires a good understanding of state-of-the-art techniques in parallel computing, spatial computing, optimization of algorithms, and benchmarking, along with a strong understanding of computer architecture.

You must possess strong verbal and written communication skills and the demonstrated ability to work in a demanding team-oriented environment. The candidate is expected to maintain substantial knowledge of state-of-the-art principles and theories, and contribute regularly to scientific literature and the research community-at-large. May also participate in the development of intellectual property


Qualifications


Must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Pursuing a PhD in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering or a related engineering discipline.
  • 6+ months of experience in the development of parallel computing algorithms and/or frameworks.
  • 6+ months of experience in parallel programming.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in research related to high-performance computations on FPGAs or CGRAs.
  • Experience with Halide is a plus.

Inside this Business Group


Intel Architecture, Graphics, and Software (IAGS) brings Intel's technical strategy to life. We have embraced the new reality of competing at a product and solution level—not just a transistor one. We take pride in reshaping the status quo and thinking exponentially to achieve what's never been done before. We've also built a culture of continuous learning and persistent leadership that provides opportunities to practice until perfection and filter ambitious ideas into execution.

Description

The U.S. Combat Capabilities Development Command, Chemical Biological Center (DEVCOM CBC) is offering an internship at the Rock Island, Illinois facility.

What will I be doing?

As an ORISE participant, you will join a community of scientists and researchers in an effort to apply knowledge, skill, and ability (KSA) in developing web-based information system solutions, in accordance with the Department of Defense (DoD) Risk Management Framework for the Joint Acquisition Chem-Bio Knowledge System (JACKS) project. DEVCOM CBC will provide hands-on experience allowing you to enhance your skills in Microsoft .Net Framework, and .Net Core using the C# programming language, JavaScript, and various UI frameworks such as Bootstrap, and JQuery.

Why should I apply?

Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience, attend specialized classes and technical seminars to complement your education and support your academic and professional goals. During your appointment you will learn how to apply the KSA for developing software in the DoD environment and develop data auditing routines that adhere to the the Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) for Application Software. In addition, your mentor will develop personal learning objectives in accordance to your professional goals.

Additional learning objectives will include:

  • Apply communication skills to understand requirements, use cases, and propose new and innovative solutions to business analysts, and software development team leaders.
  • Experience unit testing in a Microsoft development environment and have the opportunity to propose improvements to software code unit testing.
  • Acquire skills developing information system user role functions, data integrity, and application availability monitoring and reporting.
  • Analyze, evaluate, and provide briefings on new technology proposals, trends, and concepts with emphasis on cybersecurity and system improvements

Where will I be located? Rock Island, Illinois

What is the anticipated start date?

The DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center is ready to make appointments immediately. Exact start dates will be determined at the time of selection and in coordination with the selected candidate. Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis and internships will be filled as qualified candidates are identified.

Appointment Length

This appointment is a twelve month, part-time research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center. Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location. Other benefits may include the following:

  • Health Insurance Supplement. Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE.
  • Relocation Allowance
  • Training and Travel Allowance

Nature of Appointment

You will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DoD, or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment.

About DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center

The DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center is the primary Department of Defense technical organization for non-medical chemical and biological defense. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center possesses an unrivaled chemical biological research and development infrastructure with scientists, engineers, technician, and specialists located at four different sites in the United States. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center has a unique role in technology development that cannot be duplicated by private industry or research universities. It fosters research, development, testing, and application of technologies for protecting Warfighters, first responders, and the nation from chemical and biological warfare agents. For more information about the DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center, please visit https://www.cbc.ccdc.army.mil/.

Qualifications

Candidates should be actively pursuing a bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree with the intent to graduate between May 2021 - May 2024 in one of the following areas: Computer Information System, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related information technology degree. Associate degree candidates will also be considered. Please note: undergraduate students must be Registar Office documented sophomores, juniors and seniors.

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET clearance is required. While participants will not enter into an employment relationship with DoD or any other agency, this opportunity will require a suitability investigation/background investigation. Any offer made is considered tentative pending favorable outcome of the investigation.
  • Currently have, or obtain within 6 months from starting the opportunity with the government, one of the following DoD 8570.01-M IAT Level I Certifications: A+ CE - CCNA-Security - CND - Network+ CE - SSCP
  • Complete a computing environment course such as a Microsoft Developer course within 6 months from starting the opportunity.

A complete application consists of:

  • Zintellect Profile
  • Educational and Employment History
  • Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
  • Resume (PDF)
  • Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.
  • One Recommendation

Submitted documents must have all social security numbers, student identification numbers, and/or dates of birth removed (blanked out, blackened out, made illegible, etc.) prior to uploading into the application system. All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.

If you have questions, send an email to ARMY-RDECOM@orise.orau.gov. Please list the reference code of this opportunity CCDC-CBC-2021-0005 in the subject line of the email.

How to Apply


Description

The U.S. Combat Capabilities Development Command, Chemical Biological Center (DEVCOM CBC) is offering a bachelor's level internship at the Rock Island, Illinois facility.

The Design Engineering and Test Facility (DE&TF) intern opportunity at DEVCOM CBC is for talented undergraduate students to prepare and motivate participants toward a full range of technical and professional positions in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math.

What will I be doing?

As a participant you will have the opportunity to explore a federal career and gain a competitive edge as you apply your education, talent, and skills in a variety of settings. Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience preparing samples, taking measurements, running test equipment, and collecting data for ongoing DE&TF testing efforts, assessment of laboratory equipment, and exposure to CAD modeling.

Where will I be located? Rock Island, Illinois

What is the anticipated start date? Start/end date and hours per week are negotiable.

Appointment Length

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis and internship will be filled as a qualified candidate is identified. Exact start date will be determined at the time of selection and in coordination with the selected candidate. The intent of this opportunity is to participate full-time during the summer and then part-time during school year. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by DEVCOM CBC. Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location. Other benefits may include the following:

  • Health Insurance Supplement. Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE.
  • Relocation Allowance
  • Training and Travel Allowance

Nature of Appointment

You will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DoD, or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment.

About DEVCOM CBC

The DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center is the primary Department of Defense technical organization for non-medical chemical and biological defense. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center possesses an unrivaled chemical biological research and development infrastructure with scientists, engineers, technicians and specialists located at four different sites in the United States. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center has a unique role in technology development that cannot be duplicated by private industry or research universities. It fosters research, development, testing, and application of technologies for protecting Warfighters, first responders and the nation from chemical and biological warfare agents. For more information about the DEVCOM CBC, please visit https://www.cbc.ccdc.army.mil/.

Security Clearance

While participants will not enter into an employment relationship with DoD or any other agency, this opportunity will require a suitability investigation/background investigation. Any offer made is considered tentative pending favorable outcome of the investigation.

Qualifications

Candidates should have the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance.

Experience with CAD, specifically SolidWorks, is desired, but not required.

For a full list of qualifying degree disciplines, please refer to the eligibility section below.

Safety is first priority. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, there may be additional safety precautions that all applicants must follow, such as mandatory mask wearing, maintaining physical distancing, and any/all health measure identified prior to the beginning of the internship. Refusal to comply will result in termination of the offer and/or internship.

A complete application consists of:

  • Zintellect Profile
  • Educational and Employment History
  • Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
  • Resume (PDF)
  • Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.
  • 1 Recommendation

Submitted documents must have all social security numbers, student identification numbers, and/or dates of birth removed (blanked out, blackened out, made illegible, etc.) prior to uploading into the application system. All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.

If you have questions, send an email to ARMY-RDECOM@orise.orau.gov. Please list the reference code of this opportunity CCDC-CBC-2021-0006 in the subject line of the email.

Connect with ORISE...on the GO! Download the new ORISE GO mobile app in the Apple App Store or Google Play Store to help you stay engaged, connected, and informed during your ORISE experience and beyond!

  • Citizenship: U.S. Citizen Only
  • Degree: Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree.
  • Overall GPA: 3.00
  • Discipline(s):
    • Business
    • Communications and Graphics Design
    • Computer, Information, and Data Sciences
    • Earth and Geosciences
    • Engineering
    • Environmental and Marine Sciences
    • Life Health and Medical Sciences
    • Mathematics and Statistics
    • Nanotechnology
    • Other Non-S&E
    • Other Physical Sciences

    • Social and Behavioral Sciences

Thornton Tomasetti provides engineering design, investigation and analysis services to clients worldwide on projects of every size and level of complexity. We are a growing 1500+ person firm with 10 practices: Structural Engineering, Forensics, Applied Science, Renewal, Resilience, Construction Engineering, Protective Design and Security, Facade Engineering, Sustainability and Transportation. We work on everything from landmark buildings to small-scale specialty structures, from the historic to the high performing, while balancing multiple objectives, including form, function, schedule, sustainability, constructability and budget. TALENT is at the core of our business.

Our Applied Science practice leverages a unique combination of technologies and expertise to engineer practical solutions to problems of national and international importance. We apply expertise in solid and fluid dynamics, materials science, acoustics, risk assessments and computational simulation methods to solve complex problems. We preform research, mathematical modeling, software development and design to manage risks to life safety in military platforms and installations, ships and submarines, critical infrastructure, tall buildings, public facilities, industrial and petrochemical plants and automotive and airborne vehicles. Military, government, corporate and academic clients’ value the validation of Applied Science’s software and the critical insights gained from correlating analysis with testing.

The Role

Opportunity to work on and learn from client funded projects as an intern under the supervision of licensed engineers. The successful candidate will be able to work as part of a team of engineers and architects on all phases of Electrical Engineering design and analysis for a variety of multidisciplinary Architectural & Engineering projects. Project phases will range from early programmatic studies, to design development, and construction administration. The ideal candidate is eager to learn from experience engineers.

Requirements

  • Entry level understanding of electrical engineering design and analysis concepts.

  • Interest in designing power, lighting, controls and special systems.

  • Experience with Microsoft Office programs such as Word, EXCEL, Power Point, etc.

  • A working knowledge of AutoCAD.

  • A self-motivating eager to learn personality desired.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors in Electrical Engineering

  • Completed college level coursework in power systems (generation, transmission, distribution, etc.).

  • A working knowledge of Microstation and REVIT.

  • Knowledge of electrical engineering as it is applied to buildings, power distribution, site lighting/power and overall electrical design for facilities

Fall Software Developer Intern


Location: Fort Wayne, IN


Aptera is seeking a Software Developer Intern to join our Aptera Academy. The Aptera Academy is a thorough program designed to help motivated students develop into successful software professionals. Interns are paired with an experienced mentor who will help guide them through development of client projects. If you are interested in working with modern web technologies, bridging the gap between classroom curriculum and real-world experience, while working with a software craftsmanship-oriented team, then we are interested in chatting with you!


Top reasons to join Aptera


  • Work with an experienced and successful mentor


  • Practice peer coding so you and a partner can bootstrap each other’s skills


  • Develop and hone the full suite of technical skills


  • Get hands on experience doing agile development work for paying clients


  • Experience a unique tech culture comprising both a West Coast feel and Midwest work ethic


Top things we look for in our team members


  • Passion for technology


  • Problem solver mentality


  • Strives to help others succeed


  • Friendly and easy-going personality


  • Desire to work on a team

Top skills/qualifications we look for


  • Pursuing a Software Engineering, Computer Science or related degree


  • Internship and/or classroom experience in HTML5, JavaScript and SQL


  • Object Oriented development experience (C# preferred)


  • Experience developing both front end and back end components of a web-based application


  • TDD, SPA’s and AngularJS experience preferred

As a Software Developer Intern you will


  • Work on a team to design and implement full-stack web-based solutions using C#, .NET and SQL


  • Partner with a mentor to learn Aptera’s development best practices like testing first (TDD), continuous integration and continuous delivery


  • Attend Development Team daily stand ups, huddles and developer trainings


  • Shadow consultants throughout Aptera’s client discovery process


  • Perform related work as required

Physical Requirements:

  • Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

Aptera works with clients around the globe and is headquartered in Fort Wayne, IN. For additional information about Aptera please visit our website at www.apterainc.com & our YouTube channel to see more about our company culture.


About Aptera Software


Aptera is a custom software development partner specializing in building mobile apps, web apps, and websites for enterprise-level businesses. Founded in 2003 and based in Fort Wayne, IN, we have a diverse team of onsite and remote employees around the Midwest. At Aptera, we believe that by creating a culture of learning we can empower our team members to develop the best software for our clients. With our expertise, we help clients solve complex business problems to transform the way they do business.
